title: Classification of Numbers
description: Classify numbers into categories such as rational, irrational, imaginary, etc.

categories.name: Complex Numbers
categories.description: Numbers in the form a + bi, where a and b are real numbers and i is the imaginary unit

categories.name: Imaginary Numbers
categories.description: Numbers in the form bi, where b is a real number and i is the imaginary unit

categories.name: Irrational Numbers
categories.description: Numbers that cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers

categories.name: Rational Numbers
categories.description: Numbers that can be expressed as a ratio of two integers

questions.explanation: A positive counting number.
A whole number or its negative.
Can be expressed as a fraction of two integers.
Cannot be expressed as a simple fraction; non-repeating, non-terminating decimal.
A number of the form $bi$ where $b$ is a real number and $i = \sqrt{-1}$.
A number with both a real and a non-zero imaginary part.

A terminating decimal that can be expressed as a fraction.

instructions: Choose the number of numbers you want to solve.
Your task is to classify each number into the correct category.
Drag a number to the category where it belongs.
If you make a mistake, you can move numbers between categories.
When you finish, click the Submit button to see your results and score.
